p:
Explanatory theories regarding COVID‐19 cardiovascular affection postulate that chronic cardiovascular diseases may become unstable in the setting of a viral infection as a consequence of the imbalance between the infection‐induced increase in metabolic demand and reduced cardiac reserve.
2 This imbalance, concurrent with an accentuated inflammatory response and myocardial damage, could raise the risk of acute coronary syndromes, HF, and arrhythmias.
